content: Let's try prototyping some short dialogue between human worm and proto-sarah, set in their first meeting in the real world. Human worm has left the labyrinth realm to observe reality, where things are so much more oridinary and therefor paradoxically interesting to him. But, when he sees proto-sarah who is in the throws of mania and having an existential crisis, about to injure himself, human worm steps in nervously to intervene, but does so in a compassionate and understanding way that only someone that is well acquainted with madness can summon. The rest of the details are up to you. Let's make this a series of 10 back and forth exchanges, starting with the worm abruptly calling out to Sarah in hesitant, yet protective shock with "Oh, but don't do that!"
